name: NEXT Action 1.1
description: Straight forward rush deck. Get some early ICE down and start running agendas through a remote server. Drawing after playing the opening ICE gets economy operations to provide cash, Gila Hands or Mandatory Upgrades should be your go to early agenda.

name: Chaos rush
Expensive Chess v2
description:
Simple Chess Deck to make every rrez costly. Yeah, 46 cards...I need Ice Carver + Bishops for heavy sentries like Archer. Clone Chip + Pawn to bring back caissas, since they are burned all the time. Still not completly satisfied...As soon as True Colors hit, Keyhole will probably join in....

v2 = -1 Yog.0, -1 Imp, -3 Daily Casts / +2 Liberated Accounts +3 Armitage Codebusting

name: It's A Trap!
description: What happens when you have one agenda left to win the game? The runner falls for all of your traps. This deck makes the runner think real hard about install, advance, advance actions. Its supposed to be a fast paced game, before an R&D lock is there, but even then the Snares will help.

name: Chess Club
description:
Taking a page from "Big Girls Play With Monoliths," the hook is to use Diesel and Quality time to rip through the deck as fast as possible, dumping programs into Freelance Coding Contracts for money and Test Running/Scavenging what you need to pressure the corp. Levy AR means any programs you had to pass up the first time will come back around.

The goal would be to get Opus and Deep Red down using Test Run/Scavenge or Modded on the first pass, so you can make use of Caissa to enhance your rig when you're in a position to start running over and over. You may not have a full breaker suite at all times, particularly if you need to pull out some of the specific meta-matchup programs in the deck.

name: Microwall v.0
description:
Looking for feedback. :D

Inspiration for: + Supermodernism v2 (Alsciende)

name: Fast Kate
description: Netdecked from Plugged In reports. Very strong and fast build.

name: Insufficient funds 2.0
description: Everything is expensive for the runner. build economy back quickly with marked accounts and sweeps week. I never have a ton of credits, but it doesnt matter because trashing my stuff is a huge tempo hit for the runner. Roto target is their code gate breaker, especially late game.

name: Tag N Bag
description: Looking for feedback.

name: Jinteki v2.0 ++ Extreme
Virus Party
SnoopEMP
description: Try to build up Snoop power counters. Use Snoops reveal ability to determine if invasion of privacy is worthwhile. Combine with Neural EMP for the finisher. I have played a few variations of this swapping out Snare! with Edge of World and it has played pretty well.

name: Do the Dew!
Andy's Siphoning Keyhole
The world is watching 1.1
description: Fast Advance, Make sure that all of your servers are permeable, you want the runner to be able to get in, just slowly. If you put down a tollbooth or a heimidall too early they will just work on their economy and draw breakers. Yu want them to run lean, that way you can hit them with midseason. PSF is a threat, but not a promise.

name: Andy's Siphoning Keyhole v2
So, You Wanna Play Fast Advance?
description:
So, the idea I had here was to create a SUPER fast runner who can feasibly get into any server by turn 2, maybe even turn 1, no matter what ICE the corp has laid down. (Why not Chaos Theory? Well, 2 reasons I went with Kate: her ability and link. Most of the FA decks in my meta, and seeming a lot of metas right now, are NBN and having even 1 link can be a HUGE help. And her ability makes all these installs a little cheaper, which is fantastic. The MU from CT would be nice, but Kate can make due.)

The general idea is to burst draw through your deck, looking for the super cheap version of breakers (Mimic, Corroder, Zu. 13) and getting them installed on the cheap with Kate's ability. As you continue, you want to find ways to "cheat" (Retrieval Run) the bigger, better versions of the breakers out (Garrote & Torch namely) and have maximum efficiency when running. The Akamatsu's are there for super cheap memory to accommodate all the MU that the bigger programs will take up.

Save the Test Runs, SMC's and Clone Chips for things you NEED (Sharpshooter, Deus Ex, Nerve Agent) depending on the situation. Best case scenario, you burst draw into all the programs you need, trashing the rest and grabbing them out if needed.

Your main money is Armitage and FCC. The idea here is that it is super fast money on demand, which is exactly what you need against FA Corps. MagOps needs too much MU to stay in the rig for long, plus it's upfront cost can really kill your tempo. Recycle Sure Gamble, Armitage and FCC with Levy's and keep the money train running.

Things I'd like to have: I'd LOVE to have Desperado in this deck, but the influence really needs to go programs. I thought about using a Battering Ram, but that would have just been nuts MU wise! I'd also like to use Medium, but I already have an in-faction answer for that, so that will do. I'd also like to put something like Dirty Laundry for more burst econ, but this deck has to stay at 45 cards.

name: Katman strikes
Wide Jinteki
description: A bad deck due to having limited data packs.

name: Anarch
description: Bad deck due to limited data packs, and no idea what I'm doing.

name: Nothing But Net
description: Fast advance little ice, generate income with Profiteering and operations, score seven points or let the runner die trying to do the same.

name: Jinteki megt grinder Beta 0.1
description:
This is a hypothesis deck that seeks to make only 1 remote. Built with lots of ice to protect the servers, with varied strength, should be able to stack servers deep. Economy might need reworked, but not all ice has to be rezzed, just the relevant ice. The key is to stick brain damage and make junebug more scary, or rez a hiro at the end of the runner's turn to put them at negative hand size.

2 Hiro's might go in later revisions, if this proves to be 'too much ice'

No snare because it doesn't feel probably to flatline, and I have more R&D protection than most jinteki decks, so using snare for R&D defense (which is questionable anyway) isn't relevant.

I'm trying to bring something new to the jinteki library of archetypes, let me know what you think, any glaring issues, please let me know, this is the result of about 10 minutes of thinking, so surely there will be corrections.

name: makeORbreak
description: first deck...aiming for a nice economical build using personal workshops to save on creds and only install icebreakers as needed...hopefully there's a reasonable amount of defense and regular cash inflow...should force the corp to spend more time on ice until I have the rig to lock down r&d...

name: Flash Freeze v1.3.1
description:
I'm not sold on the effectiveness of v1.4. I'm dissatisfied with the economy it presents, since it made it hard to get the larger volume of credits necessary to rez the ICE for real. However, getting an early Eve campaign was really nice in a couple of games, so I am going to try to mix up the economy a little.

Two melange, two Eve campaigns, and three Restructures, I'll drop the two Isabels for the Eves, and add a third restructure form the melange I drop.

name: Flash Freeze v1.3.2
description:
Just more experimentation. The whirlpools will go nicely with the Howlers. and the Hedge funds should help me out when my economy is dragging.

Not a fan of dropping the Interns, but if I can protect a vitruvius, it's a moot point. Archived Memories is better since it let's me recycle econ operations. With the reduced recursion, dropping an awakening centre seems like a good idea. I may lose them altogether, since in the last 15 or so games I've never played one.

name: Need More Op
description: Operations gather credit, Don't afraid to use AD, GLC can draw the one u need, or use intern to install trashes. when u have 4-5 points, power shutdown & AD can be combo to rush 2-3 points. PS first, howard back 2 shipment for SANSAN & interns, then AD, interns install agenda; shipments advance 4 times, last click advance ones for 3 points.
